0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: serum phosphorus greater than 5.5 and less than 7.5 mg/dL, initial, 800 mg ORALLY 3 times a day with meals
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: serum phosphorus greater than or equal to 7.5 mg/dL, initial, 1600 mg ORALLY 3 times a day with meals
  • End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia: dose titration, increase or decrease by 800 mg per meal at 2 week intervals, with a target serum phosphorus goal of 3.5 mg/dL to 5.5 mg/dL

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy of sevelamer carbonate in pediatric patients have not been established

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
End stage renal disease - Hemodialysis - Hyperphosphatemia

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• swallowing disorders; dysphagia and esophageal tablet retention have been reported, some severe requiring intervention and/or hospitalization; consider change to suspension formulation
  • bowel obstruction and intestinal perforation have been reported
  • report known or suspected adverse events to the United States Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Sevelamer: Micromedex: Infant risk is minimal.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain, Constipation, Diarrhea, Flatulence, Indigestion, Nausea, Vomiting
Serious
Gastrointestinal:Bowel obstruction, Perforation of intestine, Peritonitis

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Sevelamer carbonate, a non-absorbed calcium-free and metal-free crosslink polymer, binds with phosphate molecules through ionic and hydrogen bonding and reduces phosphate absorption in the dietary tract, thereby lowering the serum phosphate concentration.

0.title: Absorption
0.mono:
• Bioavailability: oral: not systemically absorbed
  • Effects of food: should be given with meals but not with enteral nutrition

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • medications whose bioavailability, safety, and efficacy may be significantly affected by concurrent administration with sevelamer carbonate should be given at least 1 hr before or 3 hr after sevelamer carbonate
  • take 3 times a day with meals
  • (powder for suspension) empty contents of 0.8 g powder packet in 30 mL of water and 2.4 g packet in 60 mL of water and mix vigorously (does not dissolve); multiple packets may be mixed together with appropriate amount of water; entire mixture should be consumed within 30 mins of preparation or resuspend mixture right before drinking (powder for suspension)

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• serum phosphorus levels
  • vitamin D, vitamin E, vitamin K (clotting factors) and folic acid levels
  • serum bicarbonate, chloride, and calcium levels

11.title: How Supplied
11.mono:
• Generic
    Oral Tablet: 800 MG
  • Renvela
    • Oral Powder for Suspension: 0.8 GM/Packet, 2.4 GM/Packet
    • Oral Tablet: 800 MG

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, dyspepsia, nausea or vomiting.
  • Instruct patient to report new onset or worsening constipation to prevent severe complications.
  • Patient should take with meals and adhere to prescribed diet.
